snippet: Two years after a trainer’s death, a ruling means less contact between human and killer whale at SeaWorld in Orlando, Fla., where trainers once rode on and kissed the whales.
abstract: Close interaction between killer whales and their trainers at SeaWorld and other amusement parks will become a thing of the past after ruling by federal Judge Ken S Welch, which will force trainers to keep a greater distance from animals or to interact with them from across a barrier; ruling comes two years after SeaWorld trainer Dawn Brancheau was dragged under water and killed by one of the whales.
lead_paragraph: Two years after a trainer’s death, a ruling means less contact between human and killer whale at SeaWorld in Orlando, Fla., where trainers once rode on and kissed the whales.

headline.seo: Killer Whale Shows Restricted at SeaWorld Orlando
headline.main: For Safety, Ballet Between Human and Killer Whale Loses Some Intimacy
headline.print_headline: For Safety, Ballet Between Human and Killer Whale Loses Some Intimacy
